alerts.createdTitle: Alert Created. Please check your email to verify.
alerts.emailHint: Enter your email address to receive alerts about this server.
alerts.serverNameHint: Enter the server name to monitor. This is the part of the Matrix ID after the @ symbol, e.g., for @alice:matrix.org, the server name is matrix.org.
alerts.created: Alert created! Please check your email to verify.

createErrorSummary.title: Error creating alert
createErrorSummary.description: An error occurred while creating the alert. Please check the form and try again.

alerts.info: Checks for alerts are performed roughly once per hour. You will receive an email to verify your alert after creation.
alerts.verificationSent: Verification email sent. Please check your inbox.

checkErrorSummary.title: Error checking alerts
checkErrorSummary.description: An error occurred while checking alerts. Please try again later.

alerts.checkInfo:
To get a list of your alerts we need to know your email. After that you get a verification email.
Clicking that link will show you the existing alerts you subscribed to and allows you to unsubscribe from them.

app.title: Matrix Connection Tester
app.description: This tool checks if a Matrix server is reachable and federates correctly with the wider Matrix network. Enter a server name to see if federation works, what software it runs, and detailed debug information about its configuration and connectivity.
app.clientDescription: This tool checks if a Matrix server has a working client-server API and provides information about its supported versions, unstable features, and well-known configuration.

form.hintExtra: The server name is the part of the Matrix ID after the @ symbol. For example, for @alice:matrix.org, the server name is matrix.org.
form.hint:
Enter the name of the Matrix server you want to query, e.g.: matrix.org
The server name is the part of the Matrix ID after the @ symbol. For example, for @alice:matrix.org, the server name is matrix.org.
form.title: Server name must be alphanumeric and can include dots and hyphens.

stats.optInLabel: Include this query in anonymized network statistics
stats.optInHint: If checked, this query will be counted in anonymized statistics about the Matrix network. No personally identifiable data is stored.

errors.componentFailedToLoad: The component failed to load. Please contact the page admin

reloadPrompt.newVersionAvailable: A new version of this app is available.

errorCodes.Unknown: An unknown error occurred during DNS resolution
errorCodes.NoAddressFound: No IP addresses were found for this hostname
errorCodes.SRVPointsToCNAME: The SRV record points to a CNAME, which is not allowed according to RFC standards
errorCodes.DNSLookupTimeout: The DNS lookup timed out - this might indicate network issues or slow DNS servers
errorCodes.SRVLookupTimeout: The SRV record lookup timed out - this is not critical as SRV records are optional

federation.title: Federation Test Results

overview.title: Federation Overview
overview.description: This page informs you about the federation status. If it is green below you can assume that the server is reachable and federates correctly with the wider Matrix network. If there it is orange or red, there are issues with the server. To debug this please check each tab step by step.

status.partiallyFailed: Federation partially failed. Check below for more information.

dns.title: DNS Resolution
dns.description: This section shows the DNS resolution results including direct IP addresses and SRV records found during the Server-Server Discovery algorithm.

directIpAddresses.title: Direct IP Addresses
directIpAddresses.description: These are the direct IP addresses resolved for the server.

srvRecords.title: SRV Records
srvRecords.description: The following SRV records were found when using the Server-Server Discovery algorithm. If you see no SRV records here, the server has no SRV records configured.

wellKnown.title: Server Well-Known Results
wellKnown.description: The following well-known results were found when querying the server for its /.well-known/matrix/server endpoint. If you see no entries here, the server has either no well-known endpoint or it is not configured correctly. If you see a m.server entry, this is the server that the Matrix client should connect to.

clientDiscovery.title: Client Discovery (.well-known/matrix/client)
clientDiscovery.description: Client-side discovery information. This is used by Matrix clients to discover information about the homeserver.

connectionErrors.title: Connection Errors
connectionErrors.description: The following connection errors were encountered when trying to connect to the server. These errors indicate issues with the network connectivity or server configuration.

raw.title: Full Raw API Response
raw.description: This is the raw JSON response from the API. It contains all the information that was used to generate the information in the other tabs. You can use this to debug issues or to see more detailed information about the server. The data below is collapsed by default for better readability.

clientServerVersions.title: Client Server Versions (/_matrix/client/versions)
clientServerVersions.showRaw: Show raw client server versions data

statistics.title: Network Statistics
statistics.versionShareTitle: Version distribution for the top 3 server types
statistics.versionNoData: No version data available for this server type

federation.apiError: ⚠️ Something went wrong talking to the API

discoverypipeline.title: Server-Discovery-Pipeline
discoverypipeline.description: The Server-Discovery-Pipeline shows the steps taken to discover and connect to the server, along with their results. (This currently only works for the well-known path)

clientServerApi.title: Client Server API Versions
clientServerApi.description: These are the Matrix Client-Server API versions that this server supports. Newer versions (v1.x) are preferred over legacy versions (r0.x) as they include the latest features and security improvements.

status.partiallyWorking: Client Server API is working but only supports legacy versions.
status.failed: Client Server API is not available.

unstableFeatures.title: Unstable Features
unstableFeatures.description: Unstable features are experimental capabilities that are being developed or tested. These features may change or be removed in future versions and are not part of the stable Matrix specification yet. Many correspond to Matrix Spec Change (MSC) proposals.

errors.failedToFetchClientServerVersions: Failed to fetch client server versions:
errors.failedToFetchClientWellKnown: Failed to fetch client well-known data:

apiErrors.API_SERVER_NOT_CONFIGURED: API server URL is not configured
apiErrors.API_HTTP_ERROR: Failed to connect to the federation API server
apiErrors.SUPPORT_HTTP_ERROR: Failed to fetch support information from the server due to HTTP error: {{status}}
apiErrors.SUPPORT_INVALID_CONTENT_TYPE:
Expected JSON response from support endpoint as per Matrix Specification with the Content-Type header containing application/json.

Note: MSC2499 proposes to lift this requirement in the future, but it has not been merged yet.
apiErrors.SUPPORT_INVALID_JSON: The JSON reply is either missing or not complete. Make sure to check the Matrix Specification as an admin of this homeserver.
apiErrors.CLIENT_DISCOVERY_FALLBACK:
Missing homeserver URL in .well-known/matrix/client. Per Matrix Spec 3.4.1 Well-known URI, this causes client compatibility issues. Some clients may require users to manually enter the homeserver URL.

Recommendation: Add m.homeserver.base_url to your well-known file.
apiErrors.CLIENT_WELLKNOWN_NETWORK_ERROR:
This could indicate:
• Network connectivity issues
• Server is unreachable
• Endpoint doesn't exist

Note: It might be a 404 response without proper CORS headers, which browsers block for security.
apiErrors.CLIENT_WELLKNOWN_CONTENT_TYPE_WARNING:
Expected application/json Content-Type header for client well-known endpoint as per Matrix Specification 1.15.

Note: MSC2499 proposes to lift this requirement, but it has not been merged yet. This may cause client compatibility issues with some implementations.
apiErrors.CLIENT_WELLKNOWN_NOT_FOUND:
Client well-known endpoint not found (404). This means the server does not provide Matrix client discovery information.

Per Matrix Spec 1.15:
This is valid but clients will need to use the server name directly as the homeserver URL.
apiErrors.CLIENT_WELLKNOWN_SERVER_ERROR: Server error when fetching client well-known. The server may be experiencing issues. Try again later.
apiErrors.CLIENT_WELLKNOWN_RATE_LIMITED: Rate limited (429) when fetching client well-known. Too many requests have been made. Wait before trying again.
apiErrors.CLIENT_WELLKNOWN_HTTP_ERROR: HTTP error when fetching client well-known. Check server configuration and Matrix Spec 1.15 compliance.
apiErrors.CLIENT_WELLKNOWN_INVALID_JSON: Failed to parse JSON from client well-known endpoint. The response body is not valid JSON as required by Matrix Spec 1.15.
apiErrors.CLIENT_WELLKNOWN_MISSING_HOMESERVER:
The m.homeserver.base_url field is required according to Matrix Spec 1.15 but was not found or is empty in the client well-known response.

Required format:
{"m.homeserver": {"base_url": "https://example.com"}}

This field must contain a valid URL pointing to the Matrix homeserver.
apiErrors.CLIENT_WELLKNOWN_INVALID_HOMESERVER_PROT: Homeserver base_url must use HTTP or HTTPS protocol according to Matrix Spec 1.15.
apiErrors.CLIENT_WELLKNOWN_MALFORMED_HOMESERVER_UR: The m.homeserver.base_url field contains an invalid URL. Must be a valid URL according to Matrix Spec 1.15.
apiErrors.CLIENT_WELLKNOWN_INVALID_IDENTITY_SERVER: Identity server base_url must use HTTP or HTTPS protocol according to Matrix Spec 1.15.
apiErrors.CLIENT_WELLKNOWN_MALFORMED_IDENTITY_SERV: The m.identity_server.base_url field contains an invalid URL. Must be a valid URL according to Matrix Spec 1.15.
apiErrors.INVALID_SERVER_NAME_FORMAT: Server name should be a domain name only, without protocol or path (e.g. matrix.org, not https://matrix.org or matrix.org/path)
apiErrors.SERVER_VERSION_NETWORK_ERROR: Failed to fetch server version endpoint. This could indicate network issues or that the server is unreachable.
apiErrors.SERVER_VERSION_NOT_FOUND: Client versions endpoint not found (404). This may indicate that the server is not a Matrix homeserver or does not support the client-server API.
apiErrors.SERVER_VERSION_SERVER_ERROR: Server error when fetching client versions. The server may be experiencing issues. Try again later.
apiErrors.SERVER_VERSION_RATE_LIMITED: Rate limited (429) when fetching client versions. Too many requests have been made. Wait before trying again.
apiErrors.SERVER_VERSION_HTTP_ERROR: HTTP error when fetching client versions. Check server configuration and Matrix Spec 1.15 compliance.
apiErrors.SERVER_VERSION_INVALID_CONTENT_TYPE: Expected application/json Content-Type header for client versions endpoint as per Matrix Specification 1.15. This violates the Matrix specification and may indicate server configuration issues.
apiErrors.SERVER_VERSION_INVALID_JSON: Failed to parse JSON from client versions endpoint. The response body is not valid JSON as required by Matrix Spec 1.15.

support.title: Support Contacts
support.description: This server has published support contacts in its .well-known/matrix/support endpoint. These contacts can help you with issues related to this server or Trust and Safety related questions.
support.adminHint: If you are the server administrator, please consider publishing your support contacts in .well-known/matrix/support to help users find assistance
support.errorHint: If you believe this is an error, please check the server configuration or contact the server administrator.
